summary: The U.S. incarcerates women at the world's highest rate. Women make up 15% of the local jail population and 8-9% of the state prison population. We reviewed maternal health care in the facilities that house women. At the time of incarceration, 4% to 5% of women reported being pregnant. Comprehensive data on these women—including their race or ethnicity—doesn't exist, although the Department of Justice is...
title: Pregnant Women in State Prisons and Local Jails: Federal Assistance to Support Their Care
